item.title: Model Computing
item.description: Phrase-Structure Grammars A vocabulary (or alphabet, азбука) $V$ is a finite, nonempty [[notes/math/discrete-math/set-theory/Set|set]] of elements called symbols (букви) А word (or sentence, дума) over $V$ is a string of finite length of elements of $V$ The empty string (or null string, празна дума), denoted by $\lambda$ (or $\varepsilon$), is the string containing no symbols.
